attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid except for natural disaster relief.
attributes.background: Use the savings for social care for our elderly and infrastructure projects.

attributes.action: op out of paying into the overseas aid budget and put this to tax to  the NHS
attributes.background: I don't want to put my tax to country's that can afford to send rockets into space when in the uk we have  old people on trolleys in hospital's we need to put the overseas budget to the NHS . if you want to pay into the overseas aid you can op in through the tax system
attributes.additional_details: read the press

attributes.action: End employer discrimination against people with colored hair tattoos,piercings.
attributes.background: Being made to look a certain way makes you feel discriminated against and put down, Having employers enforce their ''grooming guidelines'' to make you look ''normal'' when your CV and skills should be all that matters! discrimination against coloured hair ,piercings and tattoos  should be ILLEGAL
attributes.additional_details: Have you ever been told to dye Coloured hair that is outside the ''normal''  Blonde , brown , red , grey spectrum back to an ''acceptable'' colour. Been told to cover Visible tattoos, even tiny ones on ankles? Been made to ''tone down'' you ''look''  ? People can look how they want!  People , clients and customers , like individuality. My employer is currently trying to make me tone down my look. and I am SICK OF IT. Unless your piercings are an actual risk to your health or others at work.

attributes.action: Introduce a compulsory quiet time every day to avoid noise pollution for all.
attributes.background: In other countries there are certain times of day when noise pollution is against the law. We would all benefit from knowing we can look forward to a certain time of day when we can be sure we won't be disturbed by other's noise.

attributes.action: UK Armed Police to be paid slightly more than normal police officers. Danger Pay
attributes.background:
UK Armed Police are ranked and paid like normal police officers however, im sure we can all agree the two jobs are very different.

Granted they volunteer for the role however, carrying firearms and being responsible for being the first in to terrorist threats to protect the public is different.
attributes.additional_details:
They should be paid slightly more.

Im not saying pop star wage, or even a considerable amount. Im talking a couple hundred pounds extra a month as lets say, danger pay and risk over reward pay. Give them that extra satisfaction that its worth the risk. Not everyone could do their job, it requires a different human being, so pay them that difference.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offense to vote against, or block the result of a referendum.
attributes.background:
I find it utterly outrageous that there have been politcians in the goverment who have voted against the brexit referendum despite the people winning there right to freedom.

I propose all referendums are legally binding and to hinder,block or frustrate the process will become a criminal act.
attributes.additional_details: Politicians should brace democratic processes.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act to present wrong information to influence a public vote.
attributes.background: With the recent public vote in the UK it is clear that the argument was heavily influenced by individuals knowingly communicating wrong information.  The act of knowingly presenting unverified facts for influence should be  punished.  The message is that our democracy will not accept such behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: There has in the past year been an upsurge in politicians and individuals presenting fake facts to influence votes of national importance.  These "fake facts" and "fake news" have been seen as an acceptable tactic by the perpetrators. Our country needs to get this under control and send a signal because its continuation will undermine the democratic process.  Without sanctions these types of lies will undermine our society. The action needs to cover both traditional and social media.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for DVLA to disclose drivers' details to private companies.
attributes.background: DVLA should not be allowed to give out drivers names and addresses to any person or company unless a serious offence has been committed. It should be made an offence to do so.

attributes.action: Declare the Tube an essential service and force unions into compulsory mediation
attributes.background: Tube strikes have been paralyzing London for years for all kinds of reasons. The battle between the unions and TfL management leave the public in the lurch, suffering through queues and bringing roads to a standstill. They do great damage to economy, emergency services and environment.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory mediation would force both parties to the negotiating table and to achieve a fair outcome through mediation by an independent third party. Strikes are avoided and the public is not harmed by abstract, arcane industrial disputes.

attributes.action: Make  sanitary products free for secondary school girls in United Kingdom
attributes.background: The cost of sanity products has gone up and this has put a strain on the already lean purse of most household . Think the sensible thing is to cushion the effect of government cuts social benefits and the rise of income tax

attributes.action: Get Patients The Right to Appeal Removal From G.P Surgery
attributes.background:
As it stands G.Ps can have a patient removed from their list simply by requesting this.
They can cite various reasons, aggressive behaviour , breakdown of Doctor Patient relationship.

The Patient has absolutely no right to appeal or even refute allegations made against them.
attributes.additional_details:
If any individual is accused of anything they should have the right to defend themselves.

In less than one year I have been removed twice & both times the reasons given were downright blatant lies.

attributes.action: Legal Immigrants on different visas category  must get ILR
attributes.background: Those immigrants who lived in Great Britain legally for 10 years should get indefinite leave to remain without any question as long as they do not have criminal convictions
attributes.additional_details:
Tier 1 visa category
Tier 2 visa category

attributes.action: Increase UK Summer School Holidays By at Least 1-2 weeks
attributes.background: We don't get long enough holidays but schools and local authorities feel they have the need to fine us just because we leave school at least a week early. I understand education Is vital, but at least let us leave school for the summer as soon as we have finished our final exams.
attributes.additional_details: With all respect i believe it is very unfair, in the summer i would like to be seeing my family abroad not doing exams 3 weeks early then just doing nothing at school. Most Countries Including America get like 3 month holidays i am not asking for that. I am just asking for you to consider my request that we can leave school for the holidays as soon as we finish our exams. However, I understand that in some occasions it may not be possible, but i am asking you to please consider this.

attributes.action: Stop local councils cutting low paid jobs without first cutting top salaries.
attributes.background: Recently, Newcastle City Council approved an £8500 pay rise for its chief executive despite assurances to the contrary. Many local council chief executives earn more than the Prime Minister and yet jobs lower down the pay scale are cut to save money.
attributes.additional_details: Dan O'Donaghue's article for the chronicle drew this issue to my attention. 30/1/17

attributes.action: Chemists should provide receipts of prices for all items prescribed by doctors.
attributes.background: and also give information on whether the items can be purchased over the counter. this could save both the customer and the NHS a significant   amount of money and would also show how fortunate we are to have our NHS and only be paying £8.40 per item for such high priced medication.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if people knew how much they cost the NHS each month with un needed repeat prescriptions and half finished courses of medicines, as well as knowing if the drugs available to buy cheaper  over the counter it would greatly change the attitude a lot of people have with regards to our NHS and how they can make a great financial  difference to it, freeing up  money to hire more staff, pay the staff they have a decent wage  and fund further research efforts.

attributes.action: Publish a statement reminding Donald Trump @POTUS of the UN Refugee Convention.
attributes.background: The UN Refugee Convention- Note on Non-refoulement (1977) Clearly states that "The most essential component of refugee status & of asylum is protection against return to a country where a person has reason to fear persecution. This protection has found expression in the principle of non-refoulement"
attributes.additional_details: We ask our elected politicians to send a message to the US President, that any action risking a national of a country listed in his extreme vetting exec order to be returned to the country from which they sought asylum, is a  contravention of the Convention above & more so any action will be met with sanctions, inc. the requirement for any US citizen to fully disclose financial information for the last 5 years if wishing to visit the UK, until such time the said US executive order is rescinded.

attributes.action: Remove the ban on owning Dogo argentinos,
attributes.background: Since 1991 this breed has been banned in the UK under the dangerous dogs act 1991, I propose that this law to either be heavily changed or removed, as people are becoming more aware that with this specific species the dogs themselves are not the problem, but the people that misuse and abuse them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogo argentinos are used as family dogs and guard dogs In their native country, just like GSD's, dobermann's and Rottweilers, they are renowned for their loyalty, and maternal instincts, to ban on dog because it looks menacing is wrong, as it promotes people to keep them for all the wrong reasons, just like every other dog consistent training and socialisation makes them perfect pets and companions, they are smart and are a reward to own because of their close loving bond with their owners.

attributes.action: I want the Jobcentre on Eastern Avenue in Sheffield to be saved
attributes.background:
The S2 area of Sheffield is full of vulnerable people, the support that is provided from the staff in this building is very positive.
Ive attended other jobcentres in the past but they have no connection with the area or the people in it. Eastern Avenue helps you feel like your not just a statistic
attributes.additional_details: Also why is it that in Sheffield only people from our area are going to be affected? People on benefits are in financial difficulty already and can easily walk to their local jobcentre to attend appointments and now only we are going to have to travel by public transport at additional costs to ourselves. I believed that we all had equal rights in this country and all should be treated the same so why only close the one office. Once again the government in this country treat us like a statistic.

attributes.action: Contraceptive pill boxes to warn of major factors making the pill less effective
attributes.background: We would like legislation requiring manufacturers of contraceptive pills to clearly and prominently display a warning on the packaging showing the major factors in the pill being less effective. We would like a warning similar to that of a cigarette packet
attributes.additional_details: The side effects and health risk associated with all medication are contained on a large leaflet within the box. We would like to see the main factors causing the contraceptive pill to be less effective or ineffective printed in bold letters on the outside of the box. Many become pregnant each year believing that this will not happen as they have chosen to use the pill only to find that something else such as a bout of illness has stopped the pill working.

attributes.action: Reconstruct The Crystal Palace
attributes.background: The Crystal Palace was an impressive architectural feat with a design that was arguably ahead of its time.  This impressive piece of Victorian heritage was cruelly destroyed by fire in 1936, depriving too many from ever having seen it in all it's glory.  Please re-build this long lost treasure.
attributes.additional_details:
The Crystal Palace was first constructed in 1851 in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition, which showcased new technology from the Industrial Revolution. It was moved to the Sydenham/Penge area in 1854 and opened by Queen Victoria.  

As an attraction the Crystal Palace showcased a wide variety of festivals and events.  Reconstructing the Palace would be a fantastic opportunity to reinvigorate the area as a cultural hub and return a part of our history that should never have been lost.

attributes.action: Seek Closer Relations With Russia
attributes.background: Russia is a powerful nation, one that is under siege. We've all heard the countless things that Russia has done to show off it's armed forces, but can we blame them? The media heavily shows Russia as the bad guys but that's simply not true. The west are the ones at fault.
attributes.additional_details: Time and time again we provoke Russia and when we get a response our media instantly turns on it's propaganda machines and makes us look innocent. What good would it be to continue trade sanctions and threatening them with military action (Not directly - but through military drills). If we wish to have 'everlasting peace in our time' - then the solution is not to provoke a country into a state where it wishes to defend itself. Instead of such provocations we should seek diplomacy of co-operation

attributes.action: Ban the use of Body Mass Index (BMI) as a measure of obesity by NHS
attributes.background: Set in 1830 by a non-medical mathematician and astronomer, BMI is an inaccurate measure of body fat content and does not take into account muscle mass, bone density, overall body composition, racial and sex differences. When Johnny Wilkinson won the RWC he was officially overweight according to BMI.
attributes.additional_details: There is an urgent need for accurate tools to measure fat and skeletal muscle, and biomarkers that can better predict the risks of diseases and mortality. Advances to improve the measurement of obesity and related factors will help determine the optimal weight for an individual, taking into account factors such as age, sex, genetics, fitness, pre-existing diseases, as well as novel blood markers and metabolic parameters altered by obesity. (Ahima and Lazar, Science, August 2013)

attributes.action: Allow all Mains Post Offices in the UK to be able to issue passport forms.
attributes.background: Many main Post Offices are being asked for Passport forms on a daily basis. We undertake every other aspect of travel : insurance, currency, travel money cards and credit cards. Why do we have to send customers to competitors when we could issue and check and send passports?
attributes.additional_details: We want a level playing field for all main Post Offices who would all offer this essential service.

attributes.action: Call a general election in two years when the terms for Brexit are known.
attributes.background:
Whilst Parliament will be given an opportunity to comment on terms of Brexit, the UK public will not be able to vote on the biggest political decision in decades.

There is no democracy in this as the terms of Brexit were not clear when the referendum vote took place.

attributes.action: Allow people to make voluntary contributions to the NHS
attributes.background:
By signing this petition you are asking MPs to debate the feasibility of allowing the public to make voluntary financial contributions to the NHS.
Voluntary contributions could help ease the strain on the health service and the people who work in it at a time when they face unprecedented pressure.
attributes.additional_details:
Allowing members of the public to make voluntary contributions to the NHS would provide people with the means to aid and potentially save an institution that has at some point in their lives helped them. 
By signing this petition you send a message of solidarity to the workers of the NHS, that you acknowledge that the difficulties the health service currently faces are not the result of their work ethos or competence but of the funding constraints that are placed upon them.

attributes.action: To stop the £1,000 immigration skills charge for workers outside the EU
attributes.background:
The Immigration Minister Robert Goodwill has suggested.
A £1,000 immigration "skills charge" is being brought in this April for firms recruiting workers from outside the EU. This means that when we leave the EU, the 3 million EU citizens, who live in this country may have to pay this too.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-38581873

attributes.action: Enforce deadlines upon car insurance companies for the completion of claims
attributes.background: A person involved in an accident & not at fault, can wait months if the other side ignore their insurance company and don't respond, due to their being no deadline on a response from the other party. Insurance should have 28 days to investigate blame & escalate to a dispute process if no agreement

attributes.action: Ban fee paying 'private' schools so admission to all schools is based on merit.
attributes.background: Eton was founded in 1440, over 557 years ago. It is deplorable that we allow these schools to still operate in a society where they are totally out of place. When it comes to education, meritocracy is the most sensible answer. Keep Eton, the facility's, the teachers erase the price tag.
attributes.additional_details: Independent schools in the UK cost on average £13,000 a year per child, or 32.5% of the average two income household. This means that for the average citizen these schools are unfeasible. No wonder 27,000 children attending private schools are not UK citizens. This outrageously outdated system allows the elite to become richer, by granting them better educations. Oxford and Cambridge admit more Etonians each year than applicants from the whole country who qualify for free school meals, showing how these upper class elites can buy their way into life.

attributes.action: Delay plans for harsh voter ID trials until it passes a public consultation
attributes.background: In wake of the recent tower hamlets scandal, the government is trialling plans for photo voter ID laws, which would undermine democracy and disenfranchise millions of voters
attributes.additional_details: This sets a very dangerous precedent, with the possibility that many people who do not own or are unable to get a passport or driving license are not able to exercise their democratic rights, voter registration laws have already been tightened and this signals a worrying first step toward an american style system wherein voter ID laws are passed simply to prevent certain demographics from voting, these plans need at least a public consultation or some sort of free photo ID to be provided

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: invest HS2 funding into social care.
attributes.background: Social care in England is grossly underfunded, to the point of collapse, HS2 is a vanity development which should be shelved until austerity measures have passed or be completely privately funded.

attributes.action: The UK should follow Sweden, cut VAT for fixing goods rather than throwing away.
attributes.background: To combat its ‘throwaway consumer culture’, Sweden has announced tax breaks on repairs to clothes, bicycles, fridges and washing machines. Repairs are more labour-intense than production, which is largely automised, repairs actually contribute to an expanding labour market decreasing unemployment.
attributes.additional_details:
Jobs would be in the U.K. not abroad, they would be where you live & benefit the local economy.  Whereas large-scale manufacturing is very centralised. This will expand the number of companies giving these kinds of services so It’ll be easier for consumers to have things repaired.

It will be easier for people to buy high-quality products because they know it’s affordable to have them fixed if something breaks, giving an  incentive not to buy as cheap as possible and then scrap something.

attributes.action: Allow railway season ticket holders to vote on operator's franchise renewal.
attributes.background: Commuters usually have no choice about using the train. They cannot strike or otherwise inconvenience the operator in order to force improvements. They have no influence and are therefore totally ignored by the operators. Only if we can directly affect the operators will they take any notice of us.
attributes.additional_details:
If enough season ticket holders vote against renewal then the existing franchise holder is banned from being considered at any price.  
The vote would be open only to those holding monthly or longer season tickets for at least 3 months of the year. 
A majority of at least 60% (to be agreed) would be needed to remove the existing operator from consideration.

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum on whether to accept Freedom of Movement post Brexit.
attributes.background: The public voted to leave the EU. But they did this for a number of reasons, and it should not be assumed this was a direct rejection to the freedom of movement. Negotiations should not be based on the assumption that the UK public disagree with the four key principles, and a vote should be held.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) itself concluded that “The vast majority of people who voted to leave the European Union did so because they believe it is best for Britain and not because they are intolerant of others.” 
The government should acknowledge the identification of this fact, and the public disapproval of hate crime and xenophobia since the vote, and as such offer the opportunity for the freedom of movement to be decided on.

attributes.action: Make inappropriate/unwanted sexual pictures fall under the indecent exposure law
attributes.background:
Most women are subjected to unwanted sexual/inappropriate pictures from men usually of their penis on most social networking sites or phone apps
I feel this should fall under the indecent exposure laws

attributes.action: treat addiction as a mental health problem rather than criminal justice problem
attributes.background: The war on drugs has been a war fought with misinformation. We should not punish addicts but treat their addiction and what they choose to escape from when under the influence of substance abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Chasing the scream by Johann Hari

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of £25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: Enable Greater Flexible Working For Parents.
attributes.background: The cost of childcare is not the only barrier influencing parents returning to work (that's another story). Many parents find it incredibly difficult to get a job due to the rigidity of working hours. We shouldn't have to choose between going to work or being a parent. Let's change that!
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can only apply for flexible working arrangements when you have been in employment for 26 weeks. Many job seeking parents cannot work prescribed hours and care for a family, and so they are excluded from the job market. 
Rigid working hours exclude many parents from contributing to society and contributing to their family income.
Enable employers to offer greater flexibility with working hours for parents from the start. Enable flexible start and finish times, not prescribed hours.

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence to not report child abuse to the police.
attributes.background: many hundreds of children have suffered and continue to suffer because of institutional doubt.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is of course supported by the often late action of hundreds of whistle-blowers who should have reported their feelings much earlier than they did. This petition would remove both doubt and onus by making a legally required course of action perfectly clear to all concerned.

attributes.action: To stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.background: As part of my citizenship coursework, I am doing a campaign around stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998 and having the law replaced with the British Bill of Rights.

attributes.action: Increase National Minimum Wage to a minimum of £20/£25 per hour.
attributes.background: Increase the National Minimum Wage to a fair and decent level so those at the lower end of the employment ladder don't just have to survive or fight tooth and nail to get by. Instead of giving people 'benefits' like Tax Credits use that money to reduce Business Taxes so employers can cover the cost.
attributes.additional_details:
People would rather earn a decent wage than feel like they have to be supported on benefits by the government.

Reducing business taxes in this way would encourage more business to set up and invest in their companies. Also would encourage more businesses to set up in the UK.

The government spends an estimated £30 billion a year on Tax Credit. Don't give handouts to people give them a decent wage and some pride in themselves.

attributes.action: Enact a British Bill of Rights before BrExit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU must not leave a vacuum in safeguarding human rights, employment rights and other concerns for British citizens, facing fresh challenges to freedom, rights and duties in the 21st century. No major world power functions without a clear constitution. British citizens deserve clarity,
attributes.additional_details:
Britain's unwritten Constitution: https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/britains-unwritten-constitution
The UK Constitution; A summary with options for reform: https://www.parliament.uk/documents/commons-committees/political-and-constitutional-reform/The-UK-Constitution.pdf
Crowdsourcing A UK Constitution; costs and benefits: http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/constitutionuk/2014/03/10/crowdsourcing-a-uk-constitution-costs-and-benefits/

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Limit the amount in which uk councils can charge on council tax
attributes.background: Limit the amount councils can charge for council tax as recent years its getting out of control and hitting people hard.Councils also say they have to make cuts yet councils over spend on silly projects and waste money on useless departments. Better surport is needed to be given to those who strugle
attributes.additional_details:
Burton on trent east staffs wasted 30.000 on a plastic ice rink that they made a loss on and sold off for a loss. 

Amber valley wastes money on staff who are unhelpfull and heartless. 

Councils need to offer better surport to those who fall in to bad times not threaten them and make the situation harder.

attributes.action: Scrap High Speed 2 (HS2). Put forward Hyperloop for consideration.
attributes.background:
HS2 provides minimal gains over our existing rail infrastructure. The cost/ benefit ratio is unacceptable to the taxpayer at £55 billion.

If the UK is to spend this sort of money on a transport project, we should be making substantial leaps.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be achieved by implementing Hyperloop technology instead.

With recent announcements from other nations investing in Hyperloop technology, there is a very real worry that if we commit to HS2, the UK will be investing in the wrong choice. 

We'll end up with an overpriced, lacklustre rail technology that is obsolete before the project even gets started.

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.
